title: Firms scramble to build consortiums to be eligible for Rs 10,000-crore GPU plan
description: Small and medium companies are racing to form partnerships with peers and cloud service providers to become eligible for the massive Rs 10,000 crore graphics processing units (GPUs) tender by the government. As per the GPU procurement tender, central to India’s Artificial Intelligence Mission, the bidder must have installed or placed a purchase order for a minimum 1,000 GPUs.
content: Small and medium companies are scrambling to strike partnerships among themselves as well as with cloud service providers (CSPs) and large enterprises to build consortiums so that they could participate in the government's Rs 10,000 crore tender for graphics processing units (GPUs).As per the GPU procurement tender, central to India’s Artificial Intelligence Mission, the bidder must have installed or placed a purchase order for a minimum 1,000 GPUs. The bidder or the primary partner in a consortium must have an average annual turnover of more than Rs 100 crore in each of the last three financial years. For non-primary consortium members, the turnover cut off is Rs 50 crore. Also, the average annual turnover in the last three financial years from cloud operations for at least one of the consortium partners should be more than Rs 50 crore.Several of the small companies that are interested in the contract do not meet all the conditions on their own, and are seeking to form consortiums. Meanwhile, some large players are looking for local partners or those that have expertise in the segment.According to sources, ST Telemedia Global Data Centres, Tata Communications, E2E Networks, Larsen & Toubro, NTT India, CtrlS, Nvidia, Microsoft, Yotta, Neysa, Innogress Ventures and Vigyanlabs are looking for partners. Several of them attended a pre-bid meeting held by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology in the last week of August.Some others like Dell will be bidding through their partners.
